result.execSummary:
The defendant Luis Eliu Torres was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Credit of 98 days time served, straight time.
Report for probation and DNA sample by 5pm on 9/19/2022.

miscConds.notes: - Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (DNA and DV) during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
- Full time work, school or a combination.

- No use of possession of firearms.
- Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
- No contact with victim. Court will allow modification at the discretion of the agent.

- Complete a batters intervention program.
- Any treatment at the discretion of the agent.
- Provide a DNA sample.

- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random UAs.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis Eliu Torres

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Luis Eliu Torres in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Luis Eliu Torres.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant ordered to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, credit of 98 days time served, straight time.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Report for probation and DNA sample by 5pm on 9/19/2022.
- Complete a batters intervention program
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random UAs.
- Any treatment at the discretion of the agent.
- No contact with victim.  Court will allow modification at the discretion of the agent.
- No use of possession of firearms.
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- Provide a DNA sample.

- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (DNA and DV) during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition. 
Defendant advised of appeal rights.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Luis Eliu Torres in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Josh Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea hearing. Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea hearing held.  
  
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders COUNT 2 DISMISSED and READ-IN for sentencing purposes.

Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court orders current terms and conditions of bail to continue pending sentencing hearing. Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing IN PERSON. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's elements of the offense, filed.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court, defendant Luis Eliu Torres not in court, in custody. Student Intern Paul Lasswell under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Defense requests a soft resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Luis Eliu Torres in court, in custody.  Mark Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling conference. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with K.E.T. and C.L.K.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Luis Eliu Torres in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Luis Eliu Torres in custody.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Luis Eliu Torres appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case retabbed to Branch 35 Lower number case pending.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3
Scheduling Conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 8:30am

Defendant Luis Eliu Torres in court with attorney Matthew Richard Westphal.  Defendant Luis Eliu Torres in custody.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Luis Eliu Torres appeared by video means with Attorney.   Case retabbed to Branch 35 Lower number case pending. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Luis Eliu Torres not in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/23/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/23/22 @ 1p
